bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Vital Statistics Act;
date of birth means the day, month and year of birth;
place of birth means the municipality or other designated area within which the birth took place.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A reference in this regulation to "parent", "guardian" or "sibling" is a reference to the parent, guardian or sibling of the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: whose birth is sought to be registered under section 4 or 6 of the Act, or
whose death is sought to be registered under section 17 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 4 of the Act, where application is made for a delayed registration of a birth under that section, the statement required shall be supported and signed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by a parent or guardian,
if the parents and guardians, if any, are incapable, by an older sibling,
if the persons referred to in paragraph (b) are all incapable, by a person other than a minor who has personal knowledge of the facts set out in the statement, or
if the persons referred to in paragraph (b) are all incapable and no person qualifies under paragraph (c), by the person whose birth is sought to be registered.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 4 of the Act, every application made under that section shall be accompanied by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at least one document made within 4 years of the date of birth sought to be registered and in which appears a record of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the date and place of the birth sought to be registered, and
the given names and surname of each parent, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: whatever number of documents made

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: within 30 years of the date of birth sought to be registered

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that, collectively, reasonably establish the particulars of the birth.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 16 of the Act, where application is made for a delayed registration of a marriage under that section, the statement required shall be supported and signed wherever possible

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by each of the parties to the marriage,
by at least 2 witnesses to the marriage, and
by the person who solemnized the marriage.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The statement required by section 16 of the Act shall, subject to that section, be supported wherever possible

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by the statutory declaration of the person who solemnized the marriage, setting out the facts relating to the delay in registration, or
if the person who solemnized the marriage is incapable or the person's statutory declaration inadequate,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the church register of the marriage, and
by the statutory declaration of the applicant or any other person who has personal knowledge of the facts relating to the delay in registration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 20 of the Act, where application is made for a delayed registration of a death under that section, the statement required shall be supported and signed wherever possible

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by a parent or guardian,
if the parents and guardians, if any, are incapable, by a sibling, or
if the persons referred to in paragraph (b) are all incapable, by a person other than a minor who has personal knowledge of the facts relating to the delay in registration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The statement required by section 20 of the Act shall, subject to that section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: incorporate a medical certificate of death completed by the person who was required by law to complete it at the time of the death or at the time that the body was discovered, and

be accompanied by a separate declaration of the person required under paragraph (a) to complete the medical certificate of death or of any other person who has personal knowledge of the facts relating to the delay in registration.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Duties of District Registrars, Hospitals and Schools

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duties of district and deputy district registrars

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The duties of a district registrar and a deputy district registrar shall include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: examination of each statement of birth, stillbirth, marriage or death and each notice, affidavit or statutory declaration received by the district registrar or the deputy district registrar to ensure that they are correctly completed,
keeping all statements, records, notices, registrations and documents received by the district registrar or the deputy district registrar in a place of safety,
making weekly returns to the director of all registrations made by the district registrar or the deputy district registrar,
forwarding to the director, together with the relevant registrations, all statutory declarations made under section 3 of the Act,
keeping an index of all registrations that are accepted by the district registrar or the deputy district registrar and transmitted to the director,
obtaining, wherever possible, the necessary information concerning the registrations required to be made in the district registrar's or the deputy district registrar's district,

where there is reason to believe that within the district registrar's or the deputy district registrar's district a birth, death, stillbirth or marriage has taken place which has not been registered, informing the person whose responsibility it is under the Act to apply for registration of that responsibility, and

promptly notifying the director of any birth, death, stillbirth or marriage that remains unregistered after the district registrar or the deputy district registrar has discharged the district registrar's or the deputy district registrar's duty under paragraph (g).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A commission fee of $2 per notice of birth, registration of birth, stillbirth, marriage or death, or an application for any vital statistics service that is submitted to and accepted by the director, may be paid to a person appointed under section 33 (1) of the Act who is not a member of the public service.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duty of hospital authorities in respect of births

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The person in charge of the management of a hospital shall, when requested by the director, prepare and forward a monthly return, in a form approved by the director, of each birth in the hospital during that month.
For the purposes of this section, hospital means a hospital within the meaning of the Hospital Act and includes a private hospital within the meaning of Part 2 of that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duty of teachers to make returns of new pupils
bcl:section.bcl:text: The person in charge of the management of a school shall, when requested by the director, prepare and forward a return, in a form approved by the director, respecting children in the school who are attending for the first time, stating the name, date of birth and place of birth of each of them as appearing on the school record.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the discretion conferred on the director and district registrars under sections 28, 36 to 40 and 46 of the Act, the persons designated in Schedule A and their lawful and accredited representatives may have access to or may be given copies of or information from the records in the office of the director, or of a district registrar, when the access to, copies of or information from the records is required in the discharge of their official duties.
For the purposes of section 41.1 (2) (d) of the Act, the chief executive officer may enter into an information-sharing agreement with a body described in Schedule A.1.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority to sign notations on registrations

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the director or an acting director,
a district registrar or a deputy district registrar, and
an inspector, the office supervisor, certification clerk, documentary revision clerk or the registration clerk, all of whom are on the director's staff.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 10, the fees for searches, certificates and anything done or permitted to be done under the Act are those set out in Schedule B.
The fee for the alteration or addition of a given name or for the correction of an error includes the fee for any search that may be involved.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Any fee may be waived by the director in favour of any person if such action is necessary to obtain compliance with the Act or to avoid undue hardship.

bcl:centertext.in:strong: Persons Designated under Section 54 (2) (b) of the Act

bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext: 1 The person who is charged by law with the responsibility for maintaining the office of vital statistics in or established by
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: (a) the government of Canada or of any Province of Canada,
(b) the government of the United States of America or of any state of the United States of America, or
(c) the government of any member of the Commonwealth of Nations,
bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext: by whatever name that office may be known, and who is carrying out essentially the same or similar duties and functions as the director.
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: (a) the commissioner of the provincial police force appointed under section 6 of the Police Act,
(b) the commissioner of a provincial force under section 14 (2) of the Police Act,
(c) the chief constable of a municipal force established under section 26 of the Police Act,
(d) the commissioner of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police,
(e) the chief constable or commissioner of any provincial or municipal police force established under the laws of any province of Canada.
bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext: 3 The chief executive of a medical institute or medical research agency where the information is required for scientific purposes only.

4 For the purpose of obtaining a copy of statements filed in accordance with section 3 of the Act, the person who is designated as director under the Child, Family and Community Service Act and the person who is designated as director under the Adoption Act.
5 The Children's Commissioner, if the information is required for the purposes of acting as a commissioner under Part 1 of the Inquiry Act as provided for by order in council 1073/96.
